intro: Euphrasia collina subsp. speciosa, commonly known as the showy spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent markings. It has a short, hairy stem and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia collina subsp. speciosa is known for its early spring blooming period and is often found in shaded, forested areas.
